Due out this spring.

Publisher Cygames and developer Arc System Works have released the teaser trailer for Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising Character Pass Season 2 downloadable content character Galleon, who is due out this spring.

Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising is available now for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam.

Watch the teaser trailer below.

item.title: This Week’s Japanese Game Releases: AI LIMIT, The First Berserker: Khazan, Venus Vacation PRISM: DEAD OR ALIVE Xtreme, more
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/this-weeks-japanese-game-releases-ai-limit-the-first-berserker-khazan-venus-vacation-prism-dead-or-alive-xtreme-more

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Smartphone
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Atomfall, inZOI Early Access, Puella Magi Madoka Magica: Magia Exedra, etc.

AI LIMIT for PlayStation 5 and PC, The First Bersker: Khazan for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC, and Venus Vacation PRISM: DEAD OR ALIVE Xtreme for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and PC are the highlights of this week’s Japanese video game releases.

Also due out this week are Atomfall for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, the Early Access version of inZOI for PC, and the iOS and Android versions of Puella Magi Madoka Magica: Magia Exedra, among various other releases.

Get the full list of this week’s Japanese game releases below. It should be noted that Gematsu will receive a small percentage of money from purchases made through Play-Asia links. You can also save five percent with our multi-use “GEMATSU2025” coupon code.

Physical and Digital

  • AI LIMIT (PS5) – Launching digitally worldwide.
    • Asian Version (PS5)
  • Assault Suits Valken Declassified (Switch)
  • DYNAMIC CHORD feat. [reve parfait] Remaster edition (Switch)
  • The First Berserker: Khazan (PS5) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5, Xbox Series)
    • European Version (PS5, Xbox Series)
    • Asian Version (PS5)
  • goHELLgo: Tsukiotoshiteko Update Commemoration Edition (Switch)
  • Kemco RPG Selection Vol. 2 (PS5)
    • Asian Version (PS5)
  • Kemco RPG Selection Vol. 9 (Switch)
    • Asian Version (Switch)
  • Sanrio Characters Miracle Match: Magical Onigokko (Switch)
  • Setsuna ni Kakeru Koi Hanabi (PS4, Switch)
    • Limited Edition (PS4, Switch)
    • Akatsuki Yureru Koi Akari Bundle Set (Switch)
  • Venus Vacation PRISM: DEAD OR ALIVE Xtreme (PS5, PS4)
    • Premium Box (PS5, PS4)
    • Special Collection Box (PS5, PS4)
    • Asian Version – Includes English language support.
      • Standard Edition (PS5, PS4)
      • Premium Box (PS5, PS4)
      • Special Collection Box (PS5, PS4)
  • Winning Post 10 2025 (PS5, PS4, Switch)
    • Premium Box (PS5, PS4, Switch)

Digital-Only

  • AI LIMIT (PC [Steam, Epic Games Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Akatsuki: Lord of the Dawn (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • ASURAJANG (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • As We Descend Early Access (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Atomfall (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store,Microsoft Store]) – Launching physically worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5, PS4, Xbox Series / One)
    • European Version (PS5, PS4, Xbox Series / One)
  • Blue Wednesday (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Breakout Beyond (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Bubble Ghost Remake (PS5, Switch, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Chiikawa Pocket (iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.
  • Cookie Cutter Overkill Edition (Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Distant Bloom (PS5, PS4, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Dollhouse: Behind the Broken Mirror (PS5, Xbox Series, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • DOOMCRUSH (PS5) – Launching worldwide.
  • The First Berserker: Khazan (Xbox Series, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Gal Guardians: Servants of the Dark (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching digitally worldwide.
  • GladMort (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Grit & Valor: 1949 (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Fuuraiki (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide (Japanese-only).
  • HITMAN World of Assassination (PS VR2) – Launching worldwide.
  • INAYAH: Life After Gods (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • inZOI Early Access (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • KARMA: The Dark World (PS5, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store, GOG]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Mother Machine (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Puella Magi Madoka Magica: Magia Exedra (iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.
  • River Towns (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • SONOKUNI (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Sports Renovations (PS5, Xbox Series, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Star Leaping Story (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Super Nintendo Entertainment System – Nintendo Switch Online (Switch)
    • Nobunaga’s Ambition

    • Uncharted Waters: New Horizons
  • Tayutama: Kiss on my Deity (Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Twilight Monk (Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Underdogs (PS VR2) – Launching worldwide.

  • Winning Post 10 2025 (PC [Steam])

The PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch titles listed above can be purchased through Japanese PlayStation Network and Nintendo accounts using prepaid cards:

  • PlayStation Store cards (yen): 1,100 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 10,000
  • Nintendo eShop cards (yen): 1,000 / 1,500 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 9,000

Demos, Betas, Updates, etc.

  • Wuthering Waves Version 2.2 Update “Tangled Truth in Inverted Tower” (PS5, PC, iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.

item.title: Hungry Meem launches June 19
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/hungry-meem-launches-june-19

  • PC
  • Switch

Hungry creatures colony simulation game dated.

Hungry Meem, a colony simulation game about hungry creatures called Meems, will launch for Switch and PC via Steam on June 19 with English, Japanese, Korean, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language support, publishers Drecom and Clouded Leopard Entertainment announced.

Get the latest details below.

This new title is based on an original concept by Drecom, which is also handling the development.

Hungry Meem is a colony simulation game where players raise AI creatures called Meems, guiding them through generations of evolution while exploring and conquering dungeons. The game features original planning by Kenichi Nishi (known for Chibi-Robo! and moon) and world art design by Yukihito Morikawa (known for Ganbare Morikawa-kun 2-go and Jumping Flash!).

Additionally, the physical Limited Edition will include a hardcover artbook, Hungry Meem Concept Artbook, featuring beautiful illustrations of the Meems and their world, as well as a set of Meem stickers. It will also come with the exclusive downloadable content “Watermelon Halloween Set 2.”

Both the physical Limited Edition and physical standard edition will be available for pre-order starting Monday, March 24 in Japan and Asia.

■ A Message from Yukihito Morikawa, World Art Designer

Welcome to the whimsical world of the Meems!

They’re curious, a little clumsy, and sometimes even a bit selfish—but through trial, error, and the occasional squabble, they slowly grow wiser.

I hope you’ll come to love these adorable little creatures!

And while you’re at it, I hope you enjoy exploring their mysterious world, built upon the ruins of an ancient civilization!

—Yukihito Morikawa

■ About the Limited Edition

This limited edition package comes in a Meem-themed exclusive box and is packed with everything you need to fully enjoy Hungry Meem! It includes a hardcover artbook, Hungry Meem Concept Artbook, a set of unique Meem stickers, and the exclusive downloadable content “Watermelon Halloween Set 2”—available only in this edition.

  • Physical edition of Hungry Meem
  • Art book: Hungry Meem Concept Artbook – A deluxe art book featuring world sketches, concept boards, character designs of adorable Meems, early drafts, development notes, and more. Also includes exclusive hand-drawn rough sketches and a special message from Yukihito Morikawa.
  • Meem stickers – A set of original stickers featuring Meems and their favorite treats.
  • Exclusive Limited Edition downloadable content: “Watermelon Halloween Set 2” – A special downloadable content set that lets you decorate your in-game world with watermelon-themed items, including the Watermelon Street Lamp and Watermelon Hut—only available in this limited edition!

■ First Purchase Bonus / Early Purchase Bonus

The first production run of both the physical Limited Edition and physical standard edition, as well as digital purchases made by Wednesday, July 2, 2025, at 23:59 (local time), will include the exclusive downloadable content “Watermelon Halloween Set.” This downloadable content allows players to place special watermelon-themed decorations in the game, including the Watermelon Scarecrow, Watermelon Bell, Watermelon Fence, and Watermelon Arch. This bonus will be available for download after purchase.

  • ❮
  • ❯

■ About the Game

Story

One day, you come across a picture book about Meems, carefree little creatures that live under the World Tree. However, the book’s ending is a sad one… Together with the Meems, you can rewrite destiny and spin it into a happily ever after!

Characters

  • Meems – Playful little creatures who love to eat, sleep, and have fun! As they experience new things, they unlock new skills and even change their appearance. By breeding different Meems, you can create endless unique variations. Find your perfect Meem!

System

  • Grow the World Tree – The World Tree thrives on the light of joy released when Meems gather for feasts and enjoy special meals. As the tree grows, it unlocks new areas for Meems to explore and expand their adventures!
  • Build a Better Life for the Meems! – From cozy Meem Houses and Love Nests to resource centers, farms, and decorative structures, you can build a variety of facilities to improve Meem life. Gather materials on your adventures and create a happy, thriving home for your Meems!

■ Development Team

  • Original Work / Production: Drecom / E-ONE
  • World Design: Yukihito Morikawa
    • Game AI designer, graphic creator, and CEO of Morikatron. Also a part-time lecturer at University of Tsukuba. Notable works include Ganbare Morikawa-kun 2-go, Jumping Flash, AstroNoka, Kuma Uta, and Nekoga Kita. He has been responsible for game direction, game design, specification design, character design, and AI design across all of his projects.
  • Original Concept: Kenichi Nishi
    • Game creator and Director at E-ONE. Notable works include Chibi-Robo!, moon, L.O.L.: Lack of Love, and Giftpia.

Watch the opening movie below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

Opening Movie

English

Japanese

Korean

Traditional Chinese

Simplified Chinese

item.title: Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles 2 character trailers – Obanai Iguro, Sanemi Shinazugawa, and Gyomei Himejima
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/demon-slayer-kimetsu-no-yaiba-the-hinokami-chronicles-2-character-trailers-obanai-iguro-sanemi-shinazugawa-and-gyomei-himejima

Publisher Aniplex and developer CyberConnect2 have released three new characters trailers for Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles 2, introducing Obanai Iguro, Sanemi Shinazugawa, and Gyomei Himejima.

Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles 2 is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on August 1 in Japan and August 5 in the west.

Watch the trailer below.

Character Trailer #04: Obanai Iguro

Character Trailer #05: Sanemi Shinazugawa

Character Trailer #06: Gyomei Himejima

item.title: Guilty Gear: Strive DLC character Venom launches March 24
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/guilty-gear-strive-dlc-character-venom-launches-march-24

  • Arcade
  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Unrelenting pursuer in the dark of night.

Guilty Gear: Strive downloadable content character Venom will launch on March 24 for $6.99 / 880 yen, Arc System Works announced.

Here is an overview of the character, via the game’s official website:

Venom (voiced by Junichi Suwabe in Japanese, Howard Wang in English)

  • Easy to Use: ★☆☆☆☆

He is a gentle and honest man who can barely bring himself to lie. There is a rigidity to his speech that suggests he favors reason above all else, but in fact, he places high importance on emotion, empathy, and humility.

During the battle with Bedman, the leader of the Assassin’s Guild Venom dies—to the outside world, at least. After Robo-Ky saves his life, he attempts to fund his repairs by taking any work he can get, until Zato gifts him ownership of the store where he opens his bakery.

Through his new life as a baker, Venom learns of a new and unfamiliar “battle.”

He grows fond of the townspeople who fight not to take the lives of others but for their own pride, and swears to protect their “battlefield.” And so begins his new battle: baker by day, mysterious punisher “Phantom” by night.

Guilty Gear: Strive is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer and starter guide below.

DLC Character Venom Trailer

English

Japanese

Starter Guide: Venom

item.title: The Ancient Magus’ Bride: Midsummer’s Mirage and the Journey of Dreams adds PS5 and PC versions, launches October 2 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/the-ancient-magus-bride-midsummers-mirage-and-the-journey-of-dreams-adds-ps5-and-pc-versions-launches-october-2-in-japan

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch

Includes English language support.

Visual novel The Ancient Magus’ Bride: Midsummer’s Mirage and the Journey of Dreams will launch for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC via Steam on October 2 in Japan for 5,280 yen, publisher Bushiroad Games announced. It will support and English and Japanese language options. A limited edition will be available for 11,000 yen.

The Ancient Magus’ Bride: Midsummer’s Mirage and the Journey of Dreams was originally only announced for Switch earlier this month, but at the time, a YouTube premiere page for the game’s opening movie—planned for release today—had been accidently published an entire month earlier. The thumbnail of that premiere revealed the addition of PlayStation 5 and PC versions, as well as the October 2 release date. But today is the first official announcement.

Here is the story synopsis, via the official website:

A non-human being living alone in the night of London.

One night, he encounters a young girl named Letty, calling for help amidst the fog.

Rescuing her from the darkness, he learns that she has lost her memories and doesn’t know why or how she ended up there, and the two become friends.

Wanting to help the first friend he’s ever made, the non-human Sol sets out to find “The Thorn Mage” Elias and Chise—whom he has heard of through rumors from the fairies—in hopes of restoring Letty’s memories.

Watch the opening movie below.

Opening Movie
